Comment: I began this game with Bird's Opening, for psychological effect. If I can get my opponent into an opening variation they're not comfortable with, maybe I can force a mistake.
I aim to control the black squares. It's a mirror image of the English Opening, where White tries to control the white central squares.

The only chance. If Black doesn't take the bait, I'll probably have to resign in a few moves. I need an open file to get my Rooks active and to cut off Black's flight squares for his King. If Black doesn't capture the pawn on d5, I intend dxe6 fxe6 Nxe6+, which would at least keep the attack going and keep me afloat for the moment.

The logical follow-up, and Black can no longer fight off the attack. A short but very exciting game. I usually play a defensive style, and it was interesting to try something different.
